We will bring down the CD ratio faster than what we had anticipated in the past.
Retail branch continues to contribute around 80% to 85% of the total deposits. Deposit growth has been very healthy, growing around 15% year-on-year.
The margins have been stable in the range that we have been talking about at 3.45% to 3.50%. It's printed at 3.46%.
The gross NPA continues to be stable at about 1.4%. The gross slippages at 1.2% is better than what we had witnessed same time last year.

The profit after tax grew at about INR16,800 crores. It shows an optical growth rate of 5.3%, but adjusted for the bond gains and for the tax adjustments that we enjoyed same time last year -- the adjusted growth rate is about 17%.
The liquidity coverage ratio is at 128. We have told you that our target that we normally tend to operate is between 110 to 120.

Liquidity has been gradually improving over the last couple of months. However, the deposit rates continue to be elevated and sticky -- probably the credit growth still outpaces deposit growth in the system, and that maybe the reason why it continues to be sticky.

As far as the deposit is concerned, both our distribution reach, addition of the customers, working with the 96 million-plus customers and our 207,000 people are positioned to get as much as we could on the deposits with everything else permitting.
